member.name: T:NPOI.Util.LittleEndian
member.summary: a utility class for handling little-endian numbers, which the 80x86 world is replete with. The methods are all static, and input/output is from/to byte arrays, or from InputStreams.
member.remarks: @author Marc Johnson (mjohnson at apache dot org) @author Andrew Oliver (acoliver at apache dot org)

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.returns: The byteArray value
member.exception: if copying would cause access ofdata outside array bounds.

member.summary: get a short value from a byte array

members.member: Map of POILogger instances, with classes as keys

member.name: M:NPOI.Util.IO.PushbackStream.ReadByte
member.summary: Reads a byte from the stream and advances the position within the stream by one byte, or returns -1 if at the end of the stream.
member.returns: The unsigned byte cast to an Int32, or -1 if at the end of the stream.
member.exception: The stream does not support reading.
Methods were called after the stream was closed.

member.name: M:NPOI.Util.IO.PushbackStream.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, reads a sequence of bytes from the current stream and advances the position within the stream by the number of bytes read.
member.param: An array of bytes. When this method returns, the buffer contains the specified byte array with the values between and ( + - 1) replaced by the bytes read from the current source.
The zero-based byte offset in at which to begin storing the data read from the current stream.
The maximum number of bytes to be read from the current stream.
member.returns: The total number of bytes read into the buffer. This can be less than the number of bytes requested if that many bytes are not currently available, or zero (0) if the end of the stream has been reached.
member.exception: The sum of and is larger than the buffer length.
is null.
or is negative.
An I/O error occurs.
The stream does not support reading.
Methods were called after the stream was closed.

member.name: M:NPOI.Util.IO.PushbackStream.Unread(System.Int32)
member.summary: Unreads the specified b.

member.name: M:NPOI.Util.IO.PushbackStream.Close
member.summary: Closes the current stream and releases any resources (such as sockets and file handles) associated with the current stream.

member.name: M:NPOI.Util.IO.PushbackStream.Flush
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, clears all buffers for this stream and causes any buffered data to be written to the underlying device.
member.exception: An I/O error occurs.

member.name: M:NPOI.Util.IO.PushbackStream.Seek(System.Int64,System.IO.SeekOrigin)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, sets the position within the current stream.
member.param: A byte offset relative to the parameter.
A value of type indicating the reference point used to obtain the new position.
member.returns: The new position within the current stream.
member.exception: An I/O error occurs.
The stream does not support seeking, such as if the stream is constructed from a pipe or console output.
Methods were called after the stream was closed.

member.name: M:NPOI.Util.IO.PushbackStream.SetLength(System.Int64)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, sets the length of the current stream.
member.param: The desired length of the current stream in bytes.
member.exception: An I/O error occurs.
The stream does not support both writing and seeking, such as if the stream is constructed from a pipe or console output.
Methods were called after the stream was closed.

member.name: M:NPOI.Util.IO.PushbackStream.Write(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, writes a sequence of bytes to the current stream and advances the current position within this stream by the number of bytes written.
member.param: An array of bytes. This method copies bytes from to the current stream.
The zero-based byte offset in at which to begin copying bytes to the current stream.
The number of bytes to be written to the current stream.
member.exception: The sum of and is greater than the buffer length.
is null.
or is negative.
An I/O error occurs.
The stream does not support writing.
Methods were called after the stream was closed.

member.name: M:NPOI.Util.IO.PushbackStream.WriteByte(System.Byte)
member.summary: Writes a byte to the current position in the stream and advances the position within the stream by one byte.
member.param: The byte to write to the stream.
member.exception: An I/O error occurs.
The stream does not support writing, or the stream is already closed.
Methods were called after the stream was closed.

member.name: P:NPOI.Util.IO.PushbackStream.CanRead
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets a value indicating whether the current stream supports reading.
member.returns: true if the stream supports reading; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:NPOI.Util.IO.PushbackStream.CanSeek
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets a value indicating whether the current stream supports seeking.
member.returns: true if the stream supports seeking; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:NPOI.Util.IO.PushbackStream.CanWrite
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets a value indicating whether the current stream supports writing.
member.returns: true if the stream supports writing; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:NPOI.Util.IO.PushbackStream.Length
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the length in bytes of the stream.
member.returns: A long value representing the length of the stream in bytes.
member.exception: A class derived from Stream does not support seeking.
Methods were called after the stream was closed.

member.name: P:NPOI.Util.IO.PushbackStream.Position
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets or sets the position within the current stream.
member.returns: The current position within the stream.
member.exception: An I/O error occurs.
The stream does not support seeking.
Methods were called after the stream was closed.

member.name: T:NPOI.Util.ClassID

members.member: The bytes making out the class ID in correct order, i.e. big-endian.

member.name: M:NPOI.Util.ClassID.#ctor(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a and Reads its value from a byte array.
member.param: The byte array to Read from.
The offset of the first byte to Read.

member.name: M:NPOI.Util.ClassID.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a and initializes its value with 0x00 bytes.

members.member: The number of bytes occupied by this object in the byte stream.

member.name: M:NPOI.Util.ClassID.Read(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Reads the class ID's value from a byte array by turning little-endian into big-endian.
member.param: The byte array to Read from
member.returns: A byte array containing the class ID.

member.name: M:NPOI.Util.ClassID.Write(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Writes the class ID to a byte array in the little-endian format.
member.param: The byte array to Write to.

member.name: M:NPOI.Util.ClassID.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Checks whether this ClassID is equal to another object.
member.param: the object to compare this PropertySet with
member.returns: true if the objects are equal, else false

member.summary: Serves as a hash function for a particular type.
member.returns: A hash code for the current .

member.name: M:NPOI.Util.ClassID.ToString
member.summary: Returns a human-Readable representation of the Class ID in standard format "{xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxx}".
member.returns: A String representation of the Class ID represented by this object..

member.name: P:NPOI.Util.ClassID.Length
member.summary: Gets the length.
member.value: The number of bytes occupied by this object in the byte stream.

member.name: P:NPOI.Util.ClassID.Bytes
member.summary: Gets or sets the bytes making out the class ID. They are returned in correct order, i.e. big-endian.
member.value: the bytes making out the class ID..

member.name: T:NPOI.Util.StringUtil

members.member: Constructor for the StringUtil object

member.name: M:NPOI.Util.StringUtil.GetFromUnicodeLE(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Given a byte array of 16-bit unicode characters in Little Endian Format (most important byte last), return a Java String representation of it. { 0x16, 0x00 } -0x16
member.param: the byte array to be converted
the initial offset into the byte array. it Is assumed that string[ offset ] and string[ offset + 1 ] contain the first 16-bit unicode character
member.returns: the converted string

member.name: M:NPOI.Util.StringUtil.GetFromUnicodeLE(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Given a byte array of 16-bit unicode characters in little endian Format (most important byte last), return a Java String representation of it. { 0x16, 0x00 } -0x16
member.param: the byte array to be converted
member.returns: the converted string

member.name: M:NPOI.Util.StringUtil.GetFromUnicodeBE(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Given a byte array of 16-bit unicode characters in big endian Format (most important byte first), return a Java String representation of it. { 0x00, 0x16 } -0x16
member.param: the byte array to be converted
the initial offset into the byte array. it Is assumed that string[ offset ] and string[ offset + 1 ] contain the first 16-bit unicode character
member.returns: the converted string

member.name: M:NPOI.Util.StringUtil.GetFromUnicodeBE(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Given a byte array of 16-bit unicode characters in big endian Format (most important byte first), return a Java String representation of it. { 0x00, 0x16 } -0x16
member.param: the byte array to be converted
member.returns: the converted string

member.name: M:NPOI.Util.StringUtil.GetFromCompressedUnicode(System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Read 8 bit data (in IsO-8859-1 codepage) into a (unicode) Java String and return. (In Excel terms, read compressed 8 bit unicode as a string)
member.returns: generated String instance by reading byte array

member.name: M:NPOI.Util.StringUtil.PutCompressedUnicode(System.String,System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Takes a unicode (java) string, and returns it as 8 bit data (in IsO-8859-1 codepage). (In Excel terms, write compressed 8 bit unicode)
member.param: the String containing the data to be written
the byte array to which the data Is to be written
an offset into the byte arrat at which the data Is start when written

member.name: M:NPOI.Util.StringUtil.PutUnicodeLE(System.String,System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Takes a unicode string, and returns it as little endian (most important byte last) bytes in the supplied byte array. (In Excel terms, write uncompressed unicode)
member.param: the String containing the unicode data to be written
the byte array to hold the uncompressed unicode, should be twice the Length of the String
the offset to start writing into the byte array

member.name: M:NPOI.Util.StringUtil.PutUnicodeBE(System.String,System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Takes a unicode string, and returns it as big endian (most important byte first) bytes in the supplied byte array. (In Excel terms, write uncompressed unicode)
member.param: the String containing the unicode data to be written
the byte array to hold the uncompressed unicode, should be twice the Length of the String.
the offset to start writing into the byte array

member.name: M:NPOI.Util.StringUtil.GetPreferredEncoding
member.summary: Gets the preferred encoding.
member.returns: the encoding we want to use, currently hardcoded to IsO-8859-1

member.name: M:NPOI.Util.StringUtil.HasMultibyte(System.String)
member.summary: check the parameter Has multibyte character

member.name: M:NPOI.Util.StringUtil.IsUnicodeString(System.String)
member.summary: Checks to see if a given String needs to be represented as Unicode

members.member: package scope so it cannot be instantiated outside of the util package. You need a POILogger? Go to the POILogFactory for one

Check if a Logger is enabled to Log at the specified level
@param level One of DEBUG, INFO, WARN, ERROR, FATAL

Logs a formated message. The message itself may contain % characters as place holders. This routine will attempt to match the placeholder by looking at the type of parameter passed to obj1.
If the parameter is an array, it traverses the array first and matches parameters sequentially against the array items. Otherwise the parameters after message are matched in order.
If the place holder matches against a number it is printed as a whole number. This can be overridden by specifying a precision in the form %n.m where n is the padding for the whole part and m is the number of decimal places to display. n can be excluded if desired. n and m may not be more than 9.
If the last parameter (after flattening) is a Exception it is Logged specially.
@param level One of DEBUG, INFO, WARN, ERROR, FATAL @param message The message to Log. @param obj1 The first object to match against.

Logs a formated message. The message itself may contain % characters as place holders. This routine will attempt to match the placeholder by looking at the type of parameter passed to obj1.
If the parameter is an array, it traverses the array first and matches parameters sequentially against the array items. Otherwise the parameters after message are matched in order.
If the place holder matches against a number it is printed as a whole number. This can be overridden by specifying a precision in the form %n.m where n is the padding for the whole part and m is the number of decimal places to display. n can be excluded if desired. n and m may not be more than 9.
If the last parameter (after flattening) is a Exception it is Logged specially.
@param level One of DEBUG, INFO, WARN, ERROR, FATAL @param message The message to Log. @param obj1 The first object to match against. @param obj2 The second object to match against.

Logs a formated message. The message itself may contain % characters as place holders. This routine will attempt to match the placeholder by looking at the type of parameter passed to obj1.
If the parameter is an array, it traverses the array first and matches parameters sequentially against the array items. Otherwise the parameters after message are matched in order.
If the place holder matches against a number it is printed as a whole number. This can be overridden by specifying a precision in the form %n.m where n is the padding for the whole part and m is the number of decimal places to display. n can be excluded if desired. n and m may not be more than 9.
If the last parameter (after flattening) is a Exception it is Logged specially.
@param level One of DEBUG, INFO, WARN, ERROR, FATAL @param message The message to Log. @param obj1 The first object to match against. @param obj2 The second object to match against. @param obj3 The third object to match against.

Logs a formated message. The message itself may contain % characters as place holders. This routine will attempt to match the placeholder by looking at the type of parameter passed to obj1.
If the parameter is an array, it traverses the array first and matches parameters sequentially against the array items. Otherwise the parameters after message are matched in order.
If the place holder matches against a number it is printed as a whole number. This can be overridden by specifying a precision in the form %n.m where n is the padding for the whole part and m is the number of decimal places to display. n can be excluded if desired. n and m may not be more than 9.
If the last parameter (after flattening) is a Exception it is Logged specially.
@param level One of DEBUG, INFO, WARN, ERROR, FATAL @param message The message to Log. @param obj1 The first object to match against. @param obj2 The second object to match against. @param obj3 The third object to match against. @param obj4 The forth object to match against.
Flattens any contained objects. Only tranverses one level deep.

member.summary: Clear the bits.

member.name: M:NPOI.Util.BitField.GetRawValue(System.Int32)
member.summary: Obtain the value for the specified BitField, appropriately shifted right. Many users of a BitField will want to treat the specified bits as an int value, and will not want to be aware that the value is stored as a BitField (and so shifted left so many bits)
member.param: the int data containing the bits we're interested in
member.returns: the selected bits, shifted right appropriately

member.name: M:NPOI.Util.BitField.GetShortRawValue(System.Int16)
member.summary: Obtain the value for the specified BitField, unshifted
member.param: the short data containing the bits we're interested in
member.returns: the selected bits

member.name: M:NPOI.Util.BitField.GetShortValue(System.Int16)
member.summary: Obtain the value for the specified BitField, appropriately shifted right, as a short. Many users of a BitField will want to treat the specified bits as an int value, and will not want to be aware that the value is stored as a BitField (and so shifted left so many bits)
member.param: the short data containing the bits we're interested in
member.returns: the selected bits, shifted right appropriately

member.name: M:NPOI.Util.BitField.GetValue(System.Int32)
member.summary: Obtain the value for the specified BitField, appropriately shifted right. Many users of a BitField will want to treat the specified bits as an int value, and will not want to be aware that the value is stored as a BitField (and so shifted left so many bits)
member.param: the int data containing the bits we're interested in
member.returns: the selected bits, shifted right appropriately

member.name: M:NPOI.Util.BitField.IsAllSet(System.Int32)
member.summary: Are all of the bits set or not? This is a stricter test than isSet, in that all of the bits in a multi-bit set must be set for this method to return true
member.param: the int data containing the bits we're interested in
member.returns: true if all of the bits are set otherwise, false.

member.name: M:NPOI.Util.BitField.IsSet(System.Int32)
member.summary: Is the field set or not? This is most commonly used for a single-bit field, which is often used to represent a boolean value; the results of using it for a multi-bit field is to determine whether *any* of its bits are set
member.param: the int data containing the bits we're interested in
member.returns: true if any of the bits are set; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Set the bits.
member.param: the int data containing the bits we're interested in
member.returns: the value of holder with the specified bits set to 1

Check if a Logger is enabled to Log at the specified level
@param level One of DEBUG, INFO, WARN, ERROR, FATAL

Logs a formated message. The message itself may contain % characters as place holders. This routine will attempt to match the placeholder by looking at the type of parameter passed to obj1.
If the parameter is an array, it traverses the array first and matches parameters sequentially against the array items. Otherwise the parameters after message are matched in order.
If the place holder matches against a number it is printed as a whole number. This can be overridden by specifying a precision in the form %n.m where n is the padding for the whole part and m is the number of decimal places to display. n can be excluded if desired. n and m may not be more than 9.
If the last parameter (after flattening) is a Exception it is Logged specially.
@param level One of DEBUG, INFO, WARN, ERROR, FATAL @param message The message to Log. @param obj1 The first object to match against.

Logs a formated message. The message itself may contain % characters as place holders. This routine will attempt to match the placeholder by looking at the type of parameter passed to obj1.
If the parameter is an array, it traverses the array first and matches parameters sequentially against the array items. Otherwise the parameters after message are matched in order.
If the place holder matches against a number it is printed as a whole number. This can be overridden by specifying a precision in the form %n.m where n is the padding for the whole part and m is the number of decimal places to display. n can be excluded if desired. n and m may not be more than 9.
If the last parameter (after flattening) is a Exception it is Logged specially.

If the place holder matches against a number it is printed as a whole number. This can be overridden by specifying a precision in the form %n.m where n is the padding for the whole part and m is the number of decimal places to display. n can be excluded if desired. n and m may not be more than 9.

members.member:
Creates a temporary file. Files are collected into one directory and by default are deleted on exit from the VM. Files can be kept by defining the system property poi.keep.tmp.files.
Dont forget to close all files or it might not be possible to delete them.

member.name: M:NPOI.Util.IO.IOUtils.ToByteArray(System.IO.Stream)
member.summary: Reads all the data from the input stream, and returns the bytes Read.

member.name: M:NPOI.Util.IO.IOUtils.ReadFully(System.IO.Stream,System.Byte[])
member.summary: Reads the fully.

member.name: M:NPOI.Util.IO.IOUtils.ReadFully(System.IO.Stream,System.Byte[],System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Same as the normal in.Read(b, off, len) , but tries to ensure that the entire len number of bytes is Read. If the end of file is reached before any bytes are Read, returns -1. If the end of the file is reached after some bytes are Read, returns the number of bytes Read. If the end of the file isn't reached before len bytes have been Read, will return len bytes.
